channel.title: Having some trouble setting environmental variables
channel.description:
Could someone explain how to set them?
I've read tutorials, used google, and the search bar here and on runelocus.
It says I should change classpath, but I haven't got one.

item.title: Having some trouble setting environmental variables
item.dc:creator: @Surfr Surfr
item.description:
@Surfr wrote:

[quote=“the hunt”][quote author=the hunt link=topic=376356.msg2835597#msg2835597 date=1245628603]
in download section theres a god damn thing that sets them for you…
[/quote][/quote]
Tried that, came up with an error application wouldn’t start.

Thanks ryry

Read full topic
item.source: Having some trouble setting environmental variables

item.title: Having some trouble setting environmental variables
item.dc:creator: @ryry870 ryry870
item.description:
@ryry870 wrote:

  1. open up control panel. 2. look for system. 3. open up system and look for advanced settings. 4. Click on environmental variables(In advanced settings). 5. Click new and type-

Title- Classpath
Value- ;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;.

Title- PATH
Value- ;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;. but replace the jdk1.6.0_14 with the latest java version you have. (You can tell by looking at program files/java(must be a jdk!!) Pics below

So just replace the 6.0_14 with the latest version you have. Like if you have jdk1.6.0_5 put that instead of jdk1.6.0_14
Hope this helped you out

Read full topic
